reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: The only 5 star part was the hotel lobby. It is really nice and spacious with local cubans playing great music. However the bedroom smelled of stale smoke and the carpet was dirty, lots of heavy musty curtains and bed fabrics. Under the bed there was a few inches of dust and even a burned out match. We stayed in two differents rooms, one when we arrived in Havana and another two weeks later. Each time we struggled to put up with the smell in the bedroom. We stayed in cleaner and more modern bedrooms in the casas throughout the rest of our trip in cuba. Coctails & drinks over priced. A bottle of water was $6.00 cuc.
reviews.title: not a honey moon suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the junior suite and it was great. Very clean with staff desperate to help you get the most from your stay (and desperate for a tip..but who can blame them?). Beautiful pool with views over the old city. Breakfast was great with an extensive choice of dishes. Tasty lunches by the pool.
reviews.title: Fab...Best holiday ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Havana itself has so much to offer.( Avoid china Town its dirty and dangerous) but this was the only place where we felt unsafe during our site seeing around the city . The people are poor, but very friendly.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Venture out for the day (20 min cab ride ) to Marina Tarada, dont forget your passport when visiting any marina in Cuba. Get the driver to drop you at the beach there and (be brave) go eat in the ramshackle beach cafe. You wont regret it. Only one dish on the menu depending on which fish has been caught that day. Wash it down with the juice drank straight from a fresh coconut laced with havana rum. Stroll along the beach to the rocky area and snorkel to your hearts content. Cuba at its best, and a day I will never forget.
reviews.title: Waste no time discovering Havana!

likes.disliked: — An ugly building not in keeping with its surroundings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Parque Central for 3 nights before moving on to Varadero.
reviews.title: From Fabulous to Nightmare!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on previous reviews and I have to say I wasn't disappointed. Although I was there through Hurricane Gustav, the hotel coped brilliantly! They set up TV communication at reception and the staff were on hand the whole time to help. I stayed here for 3 days and after hearing a number of other travellers experiences when I got to Varadero, I think we definitely stayed at the right hotel! I'd recommend it for the location and also the overall services provided in the hotel. The food was excellent! We had to eat most meals there due to the weather and there is a good choice available in the 2 restaurants and in the bar! Breakfast choices are amazing! Cold and hot buffet and they'll make you your eggs anyway you want!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel/Great Staff....

likes.liked: — Best Choice for Havana for location / service / food...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely. We had a great view across the square and the location was excellent! Bathrooms are well equiped with seperate shower and bath and there were lovely fluffy bathrobes hanging up!
reviews.title: The best hotel in Havana/ El mejor hotel en Havana/ O melhor hotel em Havana

likes.disliked: — The snacks of the bar (hamburguers and chicken fingers, french fries, all terrible)

reviews.title: Room Safe's "not so safe"
reviews.text: We hired an open top car for a couple of hours, organised by the concierge within 5 minutes of asking. It was only 35 pesos and I have to say an experience not to be missed. The car was a bright pink Ford from 1957! The driver took us around all the sights and kept us entertained and well informed! The concierge helped us find some good salsa music in a nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only regret is that I didn't have long enough in Havana to explore and I'd have loved to have been able to take advantage of the other facilities in the hotel, such as the rooftop pool!
reviews.title: Amazing Cuba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you go to Havana, stay here!!!!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly we only stayed one night at start of our holiday which included an organised tour. The other 3 nights in Havana was spent in Nacional which wasn't nearly as good as Parque Central.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in center of Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was well appointed and quite for central Havana. The roof top pool/terrace gave good views over Havana, unfortunatley didn't have time to use the pool.
reviews.title: nice hotel ,but be careful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only sampled breakfast in hotel which was good. The hotel staff were all helpful and friendly
reviews.title: Excellent position and an oasis of calm in a bustling city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for three nights from 30 /03 11- 1 04 /11
reviews.title: Great hotel choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed in room 205 ,nice room ,over looked the square
reviews.title: Location, location, location!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was very spacious and quite clean with mini bar, flat screen tv, walk in wardrobe (inc room safe). Good sound proofing kept most of the outside noise out and so a good nights sleep was had. good view of the Capitol building etc.
reviews.title: Can reccommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good. Breakfast was definately the best we had in Cuba and after some bad expeiences of "top Cuban Restaurants" we stuck to late night snacks in the lobby area. Very edible omellete and chips or croque madam for about 6 CUCs each with a very good cup of coffee (2.5 CUCs). The lobby area was very impressive.
reviews.title: Business standard hotel in Central Havana, Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There appears to be a new bit and an old bit but as we stayed in the old bit my expeiences are limited to that. However we did go to the rooftop pool of the new bit and had a snack in the poolside bar. This bar is far to posh for a pool side one. More like a decent restaurant. We had a pizza to share with chips, a daquiri, tonic water and a beer. the bill was 25 CUCs (about £20).
reviews.title: Beautiful Place, Excellent Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The one thing that was bad was the bath which had been re-enamelled and was rusty and peeling. We found out later that re-emamelling the bathroom stuff was common in the 3 hotels (all 5*) that we stayed in. However I can forgive the peeling/rusty bath as the separate shower was good so we never used the bath. A bath lover may have cause to grumble.
reviews.title: Good nights sleep at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally I would mention the views form the roof tops of both the new and old buildings. Approx 10 floors up both rooftops have swimming pools with good 360 views of Old Havana. Clear glass(?) safety barrrier all round.
reviews.title: Great location and fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located for walking trips into old Havana and Central Havana. We looked into a number of others during our stay, including the Saratoga, and didn't find any that offered the same quality in their public areas. The standard rooms are a decent size and bathrooms have a separate shower and tub. The front desk is efficient and the money-exchange off the lobby has very similar rates to the airport. The lobby bar makes great mojitos, the best we had, but the service there is glacially slow. We did not try the restaurants, which are expensive.
reviews.title: Comfortable, great location and ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on Jan the 4th for a week after 2 weeks in Varadero.
reviews.title: It doesn't get much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in at the old part, not that old, and then took the short underground corridor to our room on the 5th floor of the new block of the hotel. I have to say that hese room are in our opinion nicer than the main building. The 5th floor also has a balcony that you can walk out on to.
reviews.title: One of the nicest hotels in Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Both buildings have roof top swimming pools and small bar/ restraunts for eating.
reviews.title: Great hotel for venturing to the Old Town Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In our opinion the pool on the older part is the better of the two and looks directly over towards the Teatro, Politico, Hotel Inglaterra, and Telegrafo, absolutely spectacular. Pools are not heated so expect to be refreshed when you jump in to them, that seems to be quite common around Cuba.
reviews.title: for me one of the 2 best hotels in La Habana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a fantastic location with a lot of the interesting tourist areas within walking distance. Both the existing and new buildings have a swimming pool on the roof with great views. The food is good but not outstanding and my only gripe would be the long wait each time you wanted to exchange money in the hotel. We found others could do it a lot faster..
reviews.title: A quality hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I did a duo trip with Air Transat to Havana/Varadero from Jan 2-Jan10, staying first at the Parque Central in Havana and before continuing on to Varadero at the Iberostar Laguna Azul.
reviews.title: Beautiful Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we were first looking at the Air Transat brochure, we looked at the less expensive Melia/Barcelo duo packages. We are glad we paid the extra to stay at the Parque Central as we found the other two hotels were far out from Old Havana and not much to do around them. I do not think our experience would have been the same if we had not been right in the old historic district.
reviews.title: Modern and comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and the location excellent. Most of our days were spent wandering Old Havana and then having a relaxing afternoon by the pool. The lobby bar is fun for an evening drink and there is wifi in the lobby if you bring a laptop. Restaurant Los Nardos (just down a few blocks in front of the Capital buildin) is good food for the money, and easy to get in if you go at lunch when they first open up (around 12).
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION FOR SEEING HAVANA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obispo street is fun to wander in the evening with lots of live entertainment. Not sure of the name but the restaurant in front of the Cathedral provides good atmosphere in the evening.
reviews.title: lovely oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Lovey hotel. Pool on roof was fantastic. Rooms very clean and staff very helpfull. Mojito in the bar were the best we had on our trip.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is superb!
reviews.title: new amongst the old

likes.liked: — its location and the pool on the roof.. gave a necesary break from the heat of sightseing, close enough to slip back to during the day for a quick dip and coolling off!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Directly on Central Park in old Havana, adjacent to the Hotel Inglaterra (oldest hotel in havana ..but no pool and no hot water according to someone staying there!) and the stunning facade of the National Theatre; Obispo Street is just around the corner with all its famed spots, leading you to all the squares, museums etc... Capitolio in sight and the Partagas factory minutes away, Malecon down the first street on right outside hotel door.... go see for yourself!
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel
Excelent Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is wonderfuly air conditioned and the blast hits you as the very friendy and efficient doorman welcomes you in. The lobby is cool with plenty of sofas and chairs to relax in. You can find a secluded spot, plenty of foliage to hide behind or go to the mezzanine area.. the bar is open all night and is the only bright source of light to this large area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Room was large and spotless with a good sized bathroom that even had a weighing scales (did not want to see them .. but handy for weighing our luggage!) Management had left us a present of a reasonable Chilean wine ( didn't like any of the cuban wines I tried) for reasons unknown! Our room faced outside to the street which I think is preferable to just looking out over the interior atrium of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic three days at the Parque Central in December. The service was excellent, rooms lovely and clean, shower hot and powerful. Toiletries re-stocked every day and towels too. I cannot understand the comments that there was 'nothing for the kids to do apart from a flat screen TV' . Unbelievable! Why on earth would you go to such an interesting place to sit indoors and watch TV? Havana is a fantastic, interesting, cool city with so much to do - what are they talking about! The rooftop pool in the hotel itself with the wonderful views of Havana can fill a whole afternoon alone! Drinking mojitos and relaxing up there was one of the best bits of our holiday. If your kids don't appreciate culture, perhaps you shouldn't take them somewhere like this. Save your money and take them to Disneyland or a theme park if that's all they like. Then perhaps there will be fewer bored, loud, shouting children ruining it for everyone else around the pool.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel couldn't fault it

likes.liked: — rooftop pool and view of Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the hotel was great, both breakfast and dinner, lots of variety especially when you see the limited food available in the shops for local people so appreciate it! but we did also venture out as people have recommended to try the local cuisine. All good. Lots to do in Havana we spent a very pleasant hour in a horse and carriage being shown round Havana and finding out about the history and politics / religion. We ensured before we got in that there would be no unscheduled stops at her mate's factory / shop / bar to make us buy things, as we have had in the past in other countries and she assured us there wouldn't be! She was right too.
reviews.title: Superb NH PC

likes.disliked: — Would have stayed an extra night but the rack rate was double the internet rate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed to read the review by the muppet who suggested getting two room keys, leaving one in to keep the air con all day long so that the room was cold when they got back from their day out! I was glad the hotel responded to this and suggested you DO NOT do this. A whole day of wasted air con and electricity just so rich westerners can be icy cold immediately you return to your five star hotel rather then having to wait a whole two minutes. Honestly. Also, you should be aware this is a country where there are often power cuts and water shortages, and things are much more scarce than we are used to at home. Be a bit sensitive and less selfish.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had no complaints about the hotel whatsoever. Our only advice is do not take American dollars to change into Cuban pesos as you used to - the exchange rate in the hotel is 20%!! There is still a whacking great 10% on all credit card transactions and UK sterling changes, but less than 20%. This was also the case in most restaurants we visited - be warned!
reviews.title: great position, service not great
3rd Visit, Still Love It!
reviews.text: The fact that the hotel manager takes the time and bothers to respond to guests' reviews on this website is a great indication of how the hotel is run. I have never seen another hotel bother to do this, so thumbs up to them for this. They really take customer service seriously.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a long week end at this hotel just two weeks ago.
reviews.title: A Central Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right from our entry into the lobby I knew that this was a first class hotel. The lobby bar in the older tower (there is an old tower and a new tower) is splendid, full of large palm trees, fountains and natural sunlight. Unlike other 5 star hotels, the prices at this bar, both for food and drinks, were extremely reasonable--to the point of being ridiculously cheap. The lobby is the focal point of the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, fantastic location and amazing roof top pool...heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our room in the new tower (as everyone else has recommended) The room rate in the new tower is slightly higher (I think $16.00 per night) but I'm told the rooms are much larger.
reviews.title: An oasis in the heart of Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TIPS: Have breakfast in the old tower, change your money in the bank in the lobby after the morning rush (around noon or so), do eat at the Montserrat bar around the corner, walk outside from one tower to the other-the tunnel involves a lot of stairs, which creates a difficult scenario when you have luggage, agree to the price in advance for the horse and buggy ride. We asked and the driver said that a one hour tour would be $25.00, however they all seem to take two hours and therefore want you to pay $50.00, which we were forced to pay. Take about $20.00 worth of dollar store items (pencils, balloons etc). Hand them out to the little kids on the street.Best bargain is the hop on/hop off bus. The round trip, which includes seeing all of Havana, including the beaches, takes about 2/and 1/2 hours--all for $5.00 and finally finish each day at the rooftop pool and bar. It is extremely peaceful.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel in a brilliant city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 Days is enough, howver I would return and repeat the same trip in about 6 months or so..
reviews.title: Great location and amazing roof top pool/patio.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This must be the best place to stay in Havana. Central location and you can stroll back for a dip in the rooftop pool between sightseeing forays. Rooftop also has hot tub, very tasty bar food, good cocktails (but not cheap) - grab long cold drink and watch the sunset. Stayed in the new building, very comfortable room with nice view. Staff friendly and helpful. Good breakfast. Wireless internet in old building, not cheap but a fast connection (by Cuban standards). It's 2 minutes walk from the Fine Arts Museum - look at the board in their courtyard for concerts (caught two amazing Cuban jazz sessions). Also check out the little conservatoire across street for classical recitals.
reviews.title: best place to stay in Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at Hotel Central Parque at the end of a 13-night, two-venue holiday with The Holiday Place. First 9 daus were spent at Guardalavaca
reviews.title: Luxury and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transfer at Havana end was smooth, and we were whisked to 5-star Central Parque, at time of booking, the highest rated hotel in Havana on Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: Quality, clean hotel in perfect spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Boy, what luxury! No more 24-hour free food and drink, but what a hotel!
reviews.title: A modern hotel in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is right in the middle of Habana Vieja, the old quarter. Malecon is a 10 minute stroll down some very pcturesque streets.
reviews.title: Great location
A Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: After spending 10 nights in Varadero, I was really looking forward to spending time in Havana. I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is in a fabulous location, and the city is very easy to navigate on foot. Check in/out was quick and efficient and the room was more than adequate. A huge room overlooking the park. The breakfast was plentiful and well presented, the pancakes were especially good. I didn't eat in the restaurants in the evening, but had a snack by the pool. Prices were typical hotel prices and the food was good. The roof pool was a welcome retreat after a hot day seeing the sights. It can be difficult to get a lounger, even later in the day. Cabin Crew from Virgin use this hotel and spent most of their time by the pool. When on the roof terrace looking out to the Capitol building, take a look at the buildings to the left of the hotel and you can see bullet holes, the aftermath of the revolution. The views reminded me of a film set.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is well worth doing a tour of the city with a guide, lots of interesting facts I had missed when using the lonley plant guide on my own tour. A visit to the cigar factory is a must, if you speak to the agency in the lobby of the hotel, they can advise you on tour times and provide a ticket. I also took a horse drawn carriage tour around the Havana. The most disappointing part of my stay in Havanna was Tropicanna, I was unsure about going in the first place. A lot of people had pointed out that it is a tourist trap but is a must see/do. I didn't really enjoy the night, and felt it was overpriced at around £50 each, added to that the cost of a taxi as it 20 minutes out of Havana and the drinks. However make your own mind up.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — The pool, breakfast and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Not have tea/coffee service in the bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Havana is infectious and I can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in the Parque Central for 8 nights. I sent an email 2 months prior requesting a room on the 7th floor facing the park. On arrival we were told that the room was unavailable however they had the exact same room on the 4th floor. What a wonderful view. We were lucky because we had a balcony on occasions we would sit out on the balcony.
reviews.title: Cuban Nightmare!!!

likes.disliked: — Pretty much everything! The staff were so rude..particularly the night manager on the 26th of June 2008.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My son (11yrs old) just loved the pool. When we returned from a long day sightseeing my son just loved to jump in the cool pool and he also made a few friends.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 3 nights at the Parque Central at the end of April. It's right in the centre of the old town which makes sight seeing very easy. We stayed in the new section and the rooms were lovely, on par with the European 5* hotels. We had breakfast at both the new section and the old building. The old building breakfast had a much larger choice of dishes.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel In Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: After the first breakfast, both me and my partner got ill a few hours ater so remember to take imodium with you!
reviews.title: Lot of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's wifi available but costs $8 for one hour, you can log on and off so it will last a few days.
reviews.title: If you want a western style hotel then this is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights with our teenagers. Arrived late after flight delays and queue at airport. The teenagers were tired and just wanted to go to bed. Had to wait for a lift which did seem to be a bit of theme in our short stay. The rooms were great we had an interconnecting room which we thought they never had. Slept really well. Breakfast was great lots of choice including wine if you like to start early. You will be mobbed when you leave this hotel with offers of taxi's etc which can be annoying and the boys found really irritating, to the point they never wanted to go out again. Through the hotel we did a horse and carriage tour of historic Havana and the boys felt more comfortable with this. It was well worth the 60cuc for 2 hours, Elmer was our guide, he spoke English and had a good sense of humour. Having done this tour it made it easier to navigate this part of the town on our own.
reviews.title: Great location, walk to everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel pool was good and the bar snacks provided at the pool bar were excellent. The boys used the gym which was empty every time they went so they liked that. The sister hotel, which you entered via an underground walk way, we found was a good way of getting outside and avoiding any touts outside the main hotel.
reviews.title: Luxury in Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can see why this hotel has been rated so highly. The location is excellent in the heart of Centro Habana and Prado, walking distance to key historical and cultural attractions in Havana. The rooms in the hotel are well equipped and far better than we anticipated for Cuba, very clean and very quiet too considering the central location. Breakfast was good (as long as you chose the large breakfast room, don’t get fobbed off with the smaller one) and let's face it, you don't go to Havana to purely eat in the hotel and sunbathe, so although the restaurant and bar choice in the hotel isn't as extensive as the large all inclusives in Varadero, you don't expect it to be. Great as part of a dual centre holiday with a beach resort like Varadero, and absolutely recommended.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It is an excellent hotel with a perfect located. The site is clean and it has a beautiful lobby. the once problems are the dusty carpets.
reviews.title: Excelente Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bath are spaciuos
reviews.title: DID I STAY IN THE SAME HOTEL AS OTHER REVIEWERS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I put all this down as my TA search only came up with the restaurant first go. The hotel is not an elegant city location but a base for coach tour loads of tourists and staff who are not interested or give wrong information. There are good ones of course but the bad are the ones you remember. The Dutch management need replacing, the standards are not 5 star at all. The pool beds are torture and the place is like a playground. The is no comfortable bar or lounge area for residents just a cafe in the foyer.Breakfast is a nightmare. Rooms are fine and cleanliness good. Rated the Italian restaurant much better than the steakhouse.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: We just returned from a ten day trip to Cuba, our holiday started in the Parque Central, from the minute we entered the hotel we had the best of service, we had contacted the hotel in advance of our stay as we were trying to make a reservation for a restaurant, and had trouble doing so from Ireland. Upon arrival we received a note from Juanita in the reservations department, telling us that our reservation had been made. This set the tone for the rest of our stay, the food was excellent, the rooms were beautiful, and as for the rooftop pool it was the icing on the cake. The Hotel is central to walking the town of havana. We recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Havana/
reviews.title: 5 Star hotel in 5 starLocation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the NH Parque Central for 4 days in November/December as part of a twin centre package with 10 nights in Varadero.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was fairly straightforward and we were quickly given a second floor room on the corner of the building. Our room had a bedroom and a separate sitting area with a table and chairs, both of which had huge windows overlooking the park. Unfortunately there was scaffolding and netting up outside the windows (which meant they hadn’t been cleaned either) and you therefore couldn’t really see that well from them. Other than that it was a pleasant room, although the décor was a little old fashioned looking. (The traveller photos on trip advisor give you a good idea of what you’ll get.) The bathroom was large with a separate shower and was all kept nice and clean.
reviews.title: Central location, great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roof top pool is great – there’s a wonderful view towards the Capitol building and it’s the perfect place to watch the sun go down. There's a jacuzzi which has a great corner window across the city but it was out of use when we were there. There are only limited sun loungers around the pool and these quickly get taken so get there early if you want one. It wasn’t really clear how you got towels, drinks or food – we eventually realised there was waiter service, however service is incredibly slow so you are better going straight to the bar at the back.
reviews.title: Three Nights in Havana before Varadero

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is taken in the restaurant on the ground floor. There is the most enormous selection of food, everything you could want, hot and cold. Although breakfast was always busy we never had any problem getting a table, although the service for coffee could sometimes be slow.
reviews.title: Such a pity.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t eat in the hotel (apart from snacks on the roof) so can’t comment on the rest of the food, other than that it seemed a little more expensive than restaurants outside the hotel. There are many different places to eat nearby though – literally just round the corner are El Floridita, Castillo de Farnés (excellent food and service, although it doesn’t look much from outside) and La Zaragozana as well as the roof top restaurant at the Hotel Sevilla (good food, great view), so there is really no need to eat in the hotel. We felt safe walking around the immediate area at night so no worries there either.
reviews.title: Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't get into the Parque Central for the four nights of our Havana stay, so booked the Hotel Ingleterra for the first night then moved to PC.
reviews.title: Five Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very happy about that!
reviews.title: Probably the best......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: The PC is a true 4/5 star by western standards, large modern rooms and bathrooms, bathrobes, safe, toiletries, TV with plenty of (american and spanish) channels and good air-con.
reviews.title: The right choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast in particular was excellent with a range of hot and cold buffet - pretty much everything you could think of - and eggs cooked to order - it could keep you going all day. My only tip here is if you drink tea to BYO tea bags as they only do camomile/fruit teas.
reviews.title: Better Than Average But Not Great
Great location, shame about the staff.
reviews.text: The rooftop pool is lovely and a I had great massage - at 25CUC for an hour how could you say no?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel independantly during a 2-week package deal to Varadero. We decided to treat ourselves to a mini city break to Havana but didn't want to join in with any of the standard tours run from the hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing views of old Havana from the roof!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were all very pleasant and helpful even when the crazy Cuban monetary system caused confusion at check out - watch out for the massive hike in price for paying in cash, and an even bigger sur charge for using a credit card! The advertised rate is not what you will eventually pay!!!
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — The touruist office in the lobby were very pushy about certain events

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is worth the money though - very plush and great location. Also nearby is the very grand International hotel - a peek at Havana in its heyday? A stark contrast to some of the living conditions only a couple of streets away, but excellently located for exploring all the main sites of the old town by foot. The roof top pool is a great feature and provides panoramic views of the city. Enjoyed our days wandering around taking it all in, and our evenings enjoying the local bars and restaurants - make sure you check out the live music found in many of the nearby bars.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay in Havana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall - Brilliant and would strongly recommend for a treat or romantic break!
reviews.title: Poor problem handling lets this hotel down
Perfect ending to our trip
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Parque Central in mid december. We arrived to a very clean room, having asked for a high floor at the front of the hotel. We got this-the view of the park was fantastic and the double glazing meant no disturbed sleep, despite the constant noise outside. The room is of an international standard-you could have been anywhere in the world, but I don't man this as a bad thing-the room was enormous, with a nice seating area and great bathroom with separate shower-which was fab!
